info.description: This is the backend API for the Developer Portal, providing endpoints for managing organizations, teams, projects, components, and deployments.
info.title: Developer Portal Backend API

post.description: Send chat messages to a deployed model and get AI responses
post.summary: Chat inference with AI Core deployed model

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

get.description: Get all configurations from AI Core for the authenticated user's team

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

post.description: Create a new configuration in AI Core for the authenticated user's team

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

get.description: Get all deployments from AI Core for the authenticated user's team

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

post.description: Create a new deployment in AI Core using either an existing configuration ID or by creating a new configuration first

parameters.description: Deployment data - either configurationId or configurationRequest must be provided
parameters.name: deployment

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific deployment from AI Core

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

delete.description: Mark deployment as deleted in AI Core

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

patch.description: Update target status or configuration of a deployment in AI Core

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

get.description: Returns current username and AI instances derived from metadata and team role

200.description: Successfully retrieved AI Core user context

get.description: Get all available models from AI Core for a specific scenario

parameters.description: Scenario ID to get models for
parameters.name: scenarioId

403.description: User not assigned to team or team credentials not found

post.description: Upload multiple files for use in multimodal AI requests (combined max 5MB)
post.summary: Upload file attachments for AI inference

post.description: Validate JWT token and return token claims

401.description: Authorization header required or token invalid

get.description: Handle OAuth callback from provider and return authentication result in HTML frame

200.description: HTML page that posts authentication result to opener window

post.description: Logout user and invalidate authentication session

get.description: Refresh or validate authentication token using refresh token, Authorization header, or session cookies

parameters.description: Refresh token to use for getting new access token
parameters.name: refresh_token

get.description: Initiate OAuth authentication flow with the specified provider

302.description: Redirect to OAuth provider authorization URL

get.description: Get all categories with pagination support
List components filtered by either team-id or project-name. Returns an array of minimal component views. One of team-id or project-name is required.

parameters.description: Team ID (UUID) to filter by owner_id
parameters.name: team-id

400.description: team-id or project-name parameter is required

post.description:
Creates a new documentation endpoint for a team. The URL should be a valid GitHub URL.
created_by is derived from the bearer token 'username' claim.

get.description: Retrieves a documentation by its UUID

delete.description: Deletes a documentation from the documentations table by the given UUID

patch.description:
Updates an existing documentation. All fields are optional.
updated_by is derived from the bearer token 'username' claim.

get.description: Proxies requests to GitHub assets with authentication. Used by the documentation viewer for images.

parameters.description: Full URL to the GitHub asset
parameters.name: url

get.description: Returns the average time to merge pull requests for the authenticated user over a specified period (default 30 days). The response includes both aggregate metrics (overall average and PR count) and a time series breakdown by date for visualization. The time is calculated as the duration between PR creation and merge (mergedAt - createdAt) in hours.

Returns the total number of contributions made by the authenticated user. If no period specified, uses GitHub's default (last year based on user's timezone). Uses GitHub GraphQL API to fetch contribution data.

parameters.description: Time period in days (e.g., '30d', '90d', '365d'). If omitted, uses GitHub's default period. Maximum: 365 days
parameters.name: period

get.description: Returns all pull requests created by the authenticated user across all repositories they have access to

parameters.description: Filter by state: open, closed, all
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Sort by: created, updated, popularity, long-running
parameters.name: sort

patch.description: Closes an open PR for the authenticated user. Optionally deletes the PR branch when delete_branch is 'true'.

parameters.description: Request body: owner, repo, delete_branch ('true' to delete the PR branch)
parameters.name: body

get.description: Proxies requests to GitHub API to fetch repository file or directory contents. Used by the documentation viewer.
get.summary: Get repository file or directory content

parameters.description: Path to file or directory (can be empty for root)
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: Git reference (branch, tag, or commit SHA)
parameters.name: ref

200.description: GitHub API response (array for directories, object for files)

put.description: Updates a file in a GitHub repository on behalf of the authenticated user

200.description: GitHub API response with commit details

get.description: Returns the contribution heatmap (contribution calendar) for the authenticated user. The heatmap shows daily contributions organized by weeks, similar to GitHub's contribution graph. If no period is specified, uses GitHub's default (last year). The provider parameter must match both the authenticated user's provider and be a valid provider configured in auth.yaml.

parameters.description: GitHub provider (must be configured in auth.yaml, e.g., 'githubtools', 'githubwdf')
parameters.name: provider

parameters.description: Time period in days (e.g., '30d', '90d', '365d'). If omitted, uses GitHub's default period. Maximum: 365 days
parameters.name: period

400.description: Invalid period parameter or provider not configured

get.description: Get the overall health status of the application including database connectivity
Check if the application is alive and responding
Check if the application is ready to serve requests
Returns Jira issues filtered by project, status, team, assignee, type, summary, and key using real Jira values with pagination

parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 50, max: 100)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Returns Jira issues for the current authenticated user with optional filtering and pagination

parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 50, max: 100)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Returns the count of Jira issues for the current authenticated user filtered by status
get.summary: Get count of my Jira issues by status

parameters.description: Date in yyyy-MM-dd format for date filtering (default: one year ago for resolved issues)
parameters.name: date

get.description: Return all landscapes that belong to the specified project (unpaginated, minimal fields)

200.description: Successfully retrieved landscapes by project name

get.description: Returns all links owned by the user with the given owner name (user_id). Example: owner=cis.devops will return all links created in the initial data.

parameters.description: Owner name (user_id). Defaults to 'cis.devops' if not provided
parameters.name: owner

post.description:
Creates a new link. Title will mirror name. Validates owner (must be existing user or team) and category_id exists. Tags are optional.
created_by is derived from the bearer token 'username' claim and is NOT required in the payload.

delete.description: Deletes a link from the links table by the given UUID

get.description: Retrieves the current status of a queued Jenkins job. Poll this endpoint to track when the job starts building and obtain the build number and URL.

parameters.description: Queue item ID (obtained from trigger response)
parameters.name: queueItemId

200.description: Queue item status with build information once started

get.description: Retrieves available parameters for a Jenkins job from the specified JAAS instance. Returns only parameters from hudson.model.ParametersDefinitionProperty.

200.description: Filtered parameter definitions containing parameterDefinitions array with name, type, defaultParameterValue, choices, and description

post.description: Triggers a Jenkins job on the specified JAAS instance with optional parameters. Returns queue information for tracking. The job is queued initially, and you can poll the queueUrl to get the actual build URL once the job starts running. Parameters can be strings, booleans, or numbers - all will be converted to strings for Jenkins. If no parameters are provided or body is empty, Jenkins will use the default values defined in the job configuration. You can override specific parameters while letting others use their defaults. The baseJobUrl points to the job definition page, not a specific build.

parameters.description: Optional job parameters as key-value pairs. Values can be strings, booleans, or numbers. Omitted parameters will use their default values from the job configuration.
parameters.name: parameters

200.description: Job successfully queued with tracking information (queueUrl can be polled to get build URL)

400.description: Missing path parameter or invalid request body

502.description: Jenkins trigger failed - check credentials or Jenkins availability

get.description: Retrieves the current status of a Jenkins build. Poll this endpoint to track the build progress and check if it has completed successfully.

200.description: Build status with result and duration

get.description: Calls Sonar APIs to retrieve measures (coverage, vulnerabilities, code_smells) and quality gate status for the given component key, merges them and returns as JSON.
get.summary: Get Sonar measures and quality gate status
List teams or fetch a specific team by name/ID

parameters.description: Team simple name; when provided returns team with members and links
parameters.name: team-name

parameters.description: Team ID (UUID); when provided returns team with members and links
parameters.name: team-id

200.description: Teams list or single team response

get.description: Returns all documentations for a specific team
Get all users with pagination

parameters.description: Search query by name or title (case-insensitive)
parameters.name: q

put.description: Update the user's team by UUID. Sets updated_by from token; updated_at is automatic.

post.description:
Create a new user row in users table
Optional fields: team_domain (default 'developer'), team_role (default 'member')
created_by is derived from the bearer token 'username' claim and is NOT required in the payload

get.description: Returns the user matching the bearer token 'username' claim, mapped to users.name
Searches LDAP directory for users where name starts with given prefix
get.summary: Search LDAP users by name prefix

get.description: Get a specific user by their UserID (e.g., I123456)

post.description: Adds the given link_id to the user's metadata.favorites array. Initializes metadata and favorites if missing, and avoids duplicates.
post.summary: Add a favorite link to a user

parameters.description: User ID (I/C/D user id, e.g. cis.devops)
parameters.name: user_id

delete.description: Removes the given link_id from the user's metadata.favorites array. Initializes metadata if missing. Idempotent if link not present.
delete.summary: Remove a favorite link from a user

parameters.description: User ID (I/C/D user id, e.g. cis.devops)
parameters.name: user_id

memberId.description: ID of member with matching email

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
